Reviews.Title: “Worse than terrible”
Reviews.Author: Hakan B
Reviews.Content: I came here for a business trip with a group. Everybody say me that Barcelona is one of the greatest cities in the world. But my 'great' trip has started as terrible. I recommend you that please do not stay here. That could be worst experience for you. There is no minibar in the rooms. Even water. Staff is very abrubt. Air conditioner just working as cooler. Heating system is not working. There are 2 elevators and one of them is not working. Front Desk is terrible. If you want blanket, towel or pillow, you will not have them. TERRIBBLE....

Reviews.Title: “Very nice place, friendly and good value”
Reviews.Author: HaimBadash
Reviews.Content: We were 2, and stayed from Sunday to Thursday. The hotel is very nice and clean. The room was clean and large, with beautifully bathroom. The breakfast was wonderfull and tasty. The service was fine, they weren't the best English speakers but they tried to understand. The hotel is located far from the center, but there is a Metro station near the hotel witch is 7 minutes away from the Placa Catalonia ( the city main square). Near the hotel there are a lot of local restaurants and shops, the prices are low and highly recommened. To sum it up I would recommend.

Reviews.Title: “!DO NOT GO !”
Reviews.Author: ghazala_ishaq12
Reviews.Content: Certainly not a four star hotel because: swimming pool small half the water gone(dilapidated, dirty, disgusting pipe above swimming pool dripping in the water; bathroom too small and cramped; place of the hotel on a main road; too noisey impossible to get to sleep;receptionist so depressing cant smile to save someones life; no fridge ,no advise or leaflets to help us ;no phone numbers of local food places; tv was old . HOWEVER, there was at least one good thing about this hotel and that was the cleaners they came and they were very lovely and kind people made us feel welcomed.

Reviews.Title: “Good value and convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Gail T
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for a short break in November 2011 after scouring the internet for a suitable value hotel in a decent area. I was surprised on arrival how far out of the centre it was but there is a subway station immediately opposite which made it simple to get to everywhere. Although on quite a busy traffic street the Hotel itself was quiet. Its a good location if you enjoy walking because its safe and an interesting walk to get to the sea and the cathedral. I took a walk in the pouring rain through back streets and discovered a wonderful old Hospital under reconstruction and a green wooded park and hilltop wartime fort before reaching Guell Park. I only discovered the trams leave to the coast not far from the hotel, on my return from the centre on my last day! I didnt eat at the Hotel and the selection of restaurants/cafes adjacent is not great but theres a small supermarket just across the road. My room was spacious, fairly modern, clean and quiet. Staff were pleasant and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “GREEK SCHOOL”
Reviews.Author: kos i
Reviews.Content: first of all,the staff was very unfriendly(except the tall security guy).the kitchen staff didn't wear any gloves.The waiters removed our plates before we even finished eating.Both PCs were broken.the toilet door was see-through.the elevator took way too long to come.Some doors could be opened without a card and it was very easy for others to break in.The sheets were filthly and disguisting and weren't changed daily.we firmly believe that the hotel should be demolished.We don't reccommend it for other schools.STAY AWAY!

Reviews.Title: “too bad”
Reviews.Author: Nikos C
Reviews.Content: the service was very unfriendly,the food was disgusting, the temperature in room is very high, when rains outside the room is full of water. the best thing is the sandwich of shemir near the hotel

Reviews.Title: “Nice modern hotel”
Reviews.Author: Thrilled_2_Travel
Reviews.Content: We arrived to our beautiful, comfortable room via a glass door elevator. Only drawback was the temperature of the room. We turned off the heater and tried to cool off the room but to no avail. I went to the reception desk to ask for assistance and was told to open a window, it will cool down in 10 minutes and that they don't have air conditioning. Well, it didn't ever really cool off. Others stated either their room was too cold or at a good temperature. So not sure about the differences. They offer free wifi. Enjoyed a delicious breakfast. The hotel is located close to the subway station.

Reviews.Title: “Nice 4 star hotel Great location”
Reviews.Author: mjm814
Reviews.Content: I was here two nights as a chaperone of a student tour group. the hotel is clean. The elevators worked great. Nice flat screen TV. Free WiFi. Modern bathroom and shower. Across the street from the Clot subway station. Comfortable bed.

Reviews.Title: “Vacation”
Reviews.Author: Shmuel B
Reviews.Content: I’d very good visit in your hotel and I would like to emphasize few major areas: 1. Room was very comfortable and clean. 2. Free Wi-Fi services was excellent. 3. Breakfast was reach with good variety of choices. 4. Front desk was very helpful. 5. The hotel location, near the underground, is very helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Have a nice stay”
Reviews.Author: GREEKSTORYTELLER
Reviews.Content: OK with facilities,Swimming pool at the top of the hotel a must,you have all city in your view but it must be summer....,breakfast and dinner caters for all.

Reviews.Title: “not bad”
Reviews.Author: defaultt
Reviews.Content: good location beside clot metro station 2 or three staions apart from the city center (catalonia square),the room was clean but small oveall ,i think it deserve 3 stars not 4 stars . very standered hotel nothing special.

Reviews.Title: “If you can sleep here, you're either deaf or drunk.”
Reviews.Author: Bill B
Reviews.Content: The hotel is like the inside of a drum. At night you hear footsteps from your own floor and the ones beneath or above. All doors shut with a loud bang and those same doors do not shut properly. We spent 5 nights there and the staff was kind enough to let us try 3 different rooms. They were all equally loud, especially with regards to noises from within the hotel. In a city like Barcelona, people arrive in their rooms till early in the morning and others leave early for their planes. Getting some sleep in this hotel is a matter of minutes, not hours. Apart from this, the rooms are worn out, stains on walls and ceilings, cracked tiles and moisture in the bathroom. No minibar and extra charge for the safe. Still, amazingly enough staff is very kind and helpfull.

Reviews.Title: “Take into consideration”
Reviews.Author: michal5
Reviews.Content: From my traveling experience (also in Spain) Catalonia Atenas is a 4* hotel only by the standard of the breakfast . There is a good variety of food , fresh and cooked - can keep you going till early afternoon. Other good things – Metro station "Colt" is just opposite the street and the main line takes you to most of the main tourist attractions. The receptionists are willing to help – mainly with questions about Barcelona. The rooms ( we stayed in 2) are spacious, good light, our rooms faced the short pedestrian ally so I didn't suffer from the street noise. Maybe the windows are double glazed. But I suggest to bring ear plugs if you are a light sleeper The 2 bathrooms we saw – were renovated. Now the cons. 1. Difficult to get things fixed or changed. They don't have fixing service after mid day. Our first room had an a/c problem. Only air came out (like a ventilator) They continued saying It does work , sent someone, next day said it had been fixed – but no change. Only a third person admitted on the second day of our stay and we were given another room. In the second room the water didn't drain as should – I didn't want to have the same experience as with the A/C so I only told the cleaning woman – hadn't been fixed. So we had a bath in the room but couldn't use it. 2. In the description of the hotel it says there is a swimming pool – so I want to warn you – it is 1.1/2 m on 1.1/2 – a joke. 3. Minibar – A 4* hotel usually has one. There is a place for it – but empty. As we were in Barcelona for 5 nights in very hot weather - it was a disadvantage.

Reviews.Title: “Santiago you are the best”
Reviews.Author: Perfectcouple24
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel ,five minutes in the metro to any location ,very good breakfast but it's not close to the center by walking so in the evening it's kind of a problem .Santiago from the reception is very kind and funny !

Reviews.Title: “Maximum 2 stars”
Reviews.Author: brightie
Reviews.Content: The rooms need urgent restoration, otherwise in a year or so will become a 1*. The cleaning services were average. Breakfast was good and rich. The room was quite small and very noisy, since the hotel is located on Avinguda Meridiana which has a very heavy throughout the day&night. There is no fridge in the room! Hotel policy the receptionist said. Staff was helpfull though. A stayed in a better 4star in India, no kidding! Definitely not worth the stars, not the price (60euro/night).

Reviews.Title: “Worst ever”
Reviews.Author: brian_k_11
Reviews.Content: 1. not a 4star, 2 at most. 2. busy reception: takes 1 hour to get soap and shampoo, requested coz empty basket left in the bathroom after cleaning. 3. not a good location: you can go most of places on a single metro line but too far. 4. smoking room for non smokers: didn't ask & can't change 5. free internet? yes, high speed? nope 6. pile of dusts on a corridor 7. CRT: havent' seen a crt tv for a while, thank you for showing me. so, why you want choose here???????

Reviews.Title: “Exceptionally BAD”
Reviews.Author: raokartik99
Reviews.Content: iv never written reviews of my experience of a hotel , but this one just made me. The beds have Bed Bugs, I changed not one but three rooms on the 7th floor, this should end the argument but No, there's no fridge in the room , no room service of any kinds after 12 , I was in Barcelona for my honeymoon and reached at 12 and were asked to pick up our own luggage, dirty lobby, dirty snack bar , bed bugs , my wife and me had rashes from the bed, great start to my honeymoon, thanks to this awful hotel. Please AVOID it. It's a nightmare

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in every repect!”
Reviews.Author: BarcelonaB
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel at random and couldn’t have chosen a better one! On arrival we were booked in quickly and efficiently & were delighted with our room on the 4th floor. Although this faced the front of the hotel we were not bothered by noise from the busy main road as the two lots of double-glazing blocked out most of the noise. The room was adequately sized for 2 people & the bathroom was clean.Towels were changed each day. Breakfast was exceptional. Some food was cooked on the spot & the choice was good. The staff were polite & welcoming. Two problems we had with the room in the course of our weeks stay were dealt with speedily. The rooftop pool, while small, is surrounded by decking where you can sit & relax. Amazing views of the city! Only 140 paces from the hotel to the top of the metro steps & then only 5 stops to Plaza Catalunya, the top of the Rambla This is also the same metro line which you would get from the bus station (Ryan Air passengers) so the hotel is conveniently placed. We will certainly use this hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Disgusting”
Reviews.Author: pj2538
Reviews.Content: This place has a serious bed bug problem! Avoid it if at all possible. It was the worst place I have ever stayed in my life! When we first checked into our room we discovered that the door to the room didn't lock. When we called to complain to the front desk they denied that it was broken, and said they were fully booked so we would have to stay in the room anyway. The next day we complained again and they bothered to come up to the room and see that the door lock was in fact broken. We were moved to a different room. However the biggest problem with the room was the bed bugs. I was itchy for the 4 nights that we stayed there, and it was absolutely disgraceful. Both rooms had the same bed bug issue - itchy, itchy, itchy. Dirty sheets and linen. In addition to this, the walls were paper thin so we could easily hear the people in the rooms either side of us - including doors slamming late at night and generally keeping us awake, along with the bed bugs crawling all over us. This place is a 1 or 2 star at absolute best. Avoid.

Reviews.Title: “Welcoming staff made stay a pleasure”
Reviews.Author: EJBluefolds
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best and friendliest hotels that I have ever stayed in anywhere in the world. We arrived before normal check in time, but were made most welcome and our luggage was locked away safely to allow us to go out and enjoy the city. We were given a map and suggestions of how to move around town by metro. When we returned the hotel was very busy, but again we were made to feel special and were handled promptly and given a voucher for a free drink at the bar. Our room was a good size with a balcony. The bed was very comfortable. We had breakfast the following morning which was a buffet with an amazing range of food on offer. The choice would suit anyones taste. Again we were able to leave our luggage in a secure room as our plane was not until the evening. The receptionists were very well trained and seemed to really enjoy their jobs and working at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “perfect location”
Reviews.Author: yagati
Reviews.Content: very close to biz centers godd clealiness quiet room especially if in rear side rooms

Reviews.Title: “Perfect compromise”
Reviews.Author: widok
Reviews.Content: The first time I have visited this hotel on May 2010 during EAGE Conference. When we decided to go to Barcelona for our holidays our chioce was simple - of course Athenas. This hotel offers perfect compromise between price location and comfort. Few minutes to metro/aitport train station. Also good starting point for car trips. Additionaly good, kind and speaking english staff and fantastic view from 11th floor swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Good price for a simple and nice hotel, not in the center, but right next to the metro station”
Reviews.Author: ofersan
Reviews.Content: The hotel is not located in the heart of Barcelona, but it is just across the "Clot" station, it is also 10 min walk from the "la segrada familia". The breakfast is also very reach and taisty. The hotel has free Wi-Fi Internet connection with good signal in the rooms. Nice pool at the top floor with nice view on Barcelona. I'd go there again.

Reviews.Title: “4 stars ... on what planet???”
Reviews.Author: Tommy_da_cat
Reviews.Content: - Room small and poorly decorated (cheap wood veneer flooring, badly fitted curtains, old upholstery, old fashioned TV) - Bathroom adequate but not exactly pleasant - Staff slow and not particularly polite - Location not great, only good thing is that there is a metro station outside - Swimming pool is pathetic (about 3m x 3m) - Breakfast buffet passable at best (poor choice of cereal, hot food greasy, coffee really not good etc) I've never stayed in a 4* this bad, and I've stayed in some 2* hotels that are nicer. AVOID.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Vacation”
Reviews.Author: cemilyplay
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I had a great experience despite reading other reviews and feeling a bit skeptical at first. The staff accommodated us efficiently after we requested a room on the 6th floor (I read that the rooms were larger). We walked to Sagrada Familia in 10-15 mins and there were many shops and restaurants close by that fed us many late nights. A huge bonus which was one of the reasons we chose this hotel was how close we were to the Metro...literally next door. Most of the places we visited were no more than 5-8 metro stops away in total with transfers. The breakfast every morning was abundant with many choices, hot and cold, sweet and savoury and staff were gracious. The room itself was very clean and we tied our beds together since they were 2 twin beds beside each other so we could sleep close and tight. The sundeck on the roof was really nice with the great weather we experienced...although the pool was small, all I wanted to do was take a dip to cool off after tanning so it was good for me. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone who wants great value, convenience and quality.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended”
Reviews.Author: Godfroid
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel in April 2010 for 3 nights. Since we get there we were impressed because it is right next to the metro station (Clot), which also is a train station for the airport's train. When we arrived, at the reception (who speak english very good) was a big noisy young italian group and the receptionist was so nice and he gave us a room far away from the italian group. Our room had a balcony, was very very clean, the towels were changed every day, the personal was very friendly, and in the last day, after the check out, we could left our luggage at the reception for free. This hotel is 2 metro station away from Sagrada Familia and about 5 or 6 stations away from the center (La Rambla). We highly recommend this hotel, the area zone is very clean and safe, a little bit noisy, but in the room there's no problem. The quality-price raport is very good. On the hotel's street are a few stores, opened till midnight. A nice story was at our arrival at this hotel: it was on 23rd of April on the St. George's Day, a very well celebrated holiday in Catalunya. The receptionist gave a rose to my girlfriend, because this is the idea of the holiday: boys gave flowers to girls. Certainly we will come back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Really helpfull staff and nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: NelsonWozzie
Reviews.Content: Me and my partner stayed at the Catalonia Atenas hotel for just 2 nights at the end of January, so we could celebrate my girlfriends birthday. Upon arriving at the hotel, we were welcomed with by an extremely helpful man behind the reception who booked us in. He was extremely helpful and provided us with a map of the city and pointed out the best places to go for sight seeing and how long he would recommend staying at each stop. We had already booke a hop-on-hop-off tour so this helped us to decide on which stops to get off at. We got to the room and was suprised on the size of it and the lovely marble floors. In the room there was also information on different sights around the city. After freshening up, we decided to go for an evening meal. Back at reception the man on the front desk stopped us and gave us information on different restaurants that he would recommend around the city. We took his advise and the meal was lovely! On our second night, we asked for a wake up call, and again the man behind the desk offered to arrange a taxi for us in the morning to take us to the bus station. All in all the hotel was really nice, the breakfasts were very good with the live cooking a nice touch and all the staff would do what they could to help. The only down side would be the location. It was on a very busy main road and to get to the nice restaurants, we would have to walk approx 30 mins to Sagrida Familia where the nice restaurants were.

Reviews.Title: “HOTEL "TOP SECRET"...Merci du CADEAU!!”
Reviews.Author: suetos
Reviews.Content: The site "Last Minute" had a very big surprise for us.Once we went to Barcelona and we booked hotel via this site. When we arrived i couldnt believe my eyes because the uggliest building of the city appeared to be my "Luxury 4 stars" hotel. The interior of the 60's never renovated, kitch, out of fashion small room, broken bed, absence of mini-bar and simply of the soap. We could hear every little noises of our neighbour's rooms like walls were made of paper. Well, im not very demanding or rich person but it was one of the worst hotel i ever stayed. And as bonus, i used to pay for the lock of safe in my room (5€ each day) and parking for my car (22€ each night). The service of the site "Last minute" made me feel that i was simply ripped off and now i know why it was so "TOP SECRET" hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Good hotel”
Reviews.Author: archie1978
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 1 night. Located next to a metro station, thus easy access city centre. Clean room, good service - no complaints. Overall not quite 4 star, but certainly solid 3 - 3+. Helpful reception staff with good command of English.

Reviews.Title: “Decent, but max 3 stars”
Reviews.Author: borda
Reviews.Content: We could get the double room for 65 EUR a night, so I must say I'm rather happy with the choice. But I wouldn't pay much more for it. It was quite noisy (windows were paper thin), beds were of bad quality, our sink was blocked and despite our asking was never unclogged, the reception staff, though nice and helpful, were really slow in processing check-ins and outs. But for the price it was a fine place, not very close to the center, but just in front of a Metro that takes you to the Plaça Catalunya and its Ramblas in 5-6 stations. It also has free WiFi, which is a great plus.

Reviews.Title: “Good, but not 4 stars”
Reviews.Author: duv67
Reviews.Content: I arrived early to the hotel as my flight came in at 9AM in Barcelona and I wanted to get rid of all my bag before going to the business conference I had to attend that day (and the next several). Arriving at the hotel around 11AM, my room was not ready yet and would not be ready for a few hours -- this was not surprising, but I was hoping to be able to get settled and cleaned up a little. Also, the female receptionist was rather cold and tried very hard to have me go to one of their other hotels in Barcelona as they had an over-booked night that day (due to a flight cancellation). I checked my bags at the front desk and headed out. When I came back later it took them a few minutes to locate my two bags. They gave me my keys and I found my way to the elevator and my room. The room was big (two beds for one person!) and had a nice view of the city, but the floor seemed a bit dirty. The bathroom was nice, but the bathtub had a broken plug -- it could not be unplugged and room service apparently broke the plug the next morning so it could drain at all... Also, the shower curtain was so thin (and of the wrong material maybe?) that water leaked right through it, despite my efforts to prevent this, and creating a huge puddle on the bathroom tile every time I showered. The shower I liked least. No refrigerator. The wake up call service worked too. There was wireless internet in the room, but it was pretty bad -- it kept dropping my connection all the time. I went to the top floor and saw a beautiful view of the city. Great view. However, the pool up there was tiny and I never tried it. The breakfast buffet was very good, but I'm not sure it is worth the money. The breakfast buffet was probably my favorite part, that and the top floor view. The hotel is not in a center location of the city, but it's very close to the metro/subway routes so you can get just about anywhere pretty quickly. I had to make a 20-30 minute bus ride to and from a conference every day and it was not ideal, but it was quite doable.

Reviews.Title: “nice good hotel”
Reviews.Author: mirk-mirk
Reviews.Content: Stayed in this hotel for 4 days in Jan 2009, had no any problems at all. The room was cleaned well ( fresh towels, new soap and shampoo even if we didn't used to the end the previous ones). Free WiFi in your room. Even a swimming pool and an open view over the town on the roof. For the money we payed that's a real bargain. Didn't deal much with the stuff, basically just to check in/out /ask about facilities/directions - had no troubles, they spoke English well . Maybe people are not used to show everybody dummy smiles in Barcelona as they used to do in London, but it's the cultural difference and you'll notice that the real attitude to people is much warmer here.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, 20 minutes from the centre of town”
Reviews.Author: Eurofriends
Reviews.Content: We were part of a Trafalgar European tour group (cost-saver). We stayed at this hotel 2 nights and really spent minimal time in the room/hotel – after all we were in Europe to sightsee! Hotel’s positives - large room - clean - modern decor - smallish but marble bathroom, with hairdryer - great views from the roof top - lovely clean, blue, non-heated, roof top plunge pool - comfortable lounge chairs around the pool and in the relaxation area - vending machine near the pool - public transport extremely close to the hotel (metro station 'Clot') - comfortable bar, bit expensive but that is standard for hotel bars Hotel’s negatives - view is of other residential buildings - 20 minutes by taxi from the city centre - no English television channels

Reviews.Title: “Just Average”
Reviews.Author: Taz_Melb
Reviews.Content: This hotel was listed on a website as a four star and the room rate seemed too good to be true. I would give it a struggling two stars... and I paid for what I got. My first impression as I attempted to get myself and my suitcase through their revolving door was just ok. I bustled up to the counter where a friendly male receptionist greeted me to tell me the hotel offered everything I needed and I was getting a room with a great view. His English was pretty good - I asked if they had a shuttle to the airport ... and I got a sharp NO! ... did it have a shuttle to La Rambla..I got another sharp NO! So much for *everything* I then got given my room card and ignored from there on. I found my own way to the elevators. Fortunately I only had one night stay as I found the room extremely small and the view was looking over the top of other buildings? The only upside was the bathroom wasn't too bad, it had a bath with an overhead shower and was clean and quite a good size considering the bedroom size. After going for a 5 minute walk outside I did not feel comfortable and was approached by two men hassling me for money, so I headed back to the hotel. I sat at the bar where a very nice bartender tried to answer my questions in broken English. While sitting at the bar a distressed lady told me she had just had her handbag stolen while she sat eating at a burger place down the road. I had previously been told to hold tight to your hand bag as pick pocketing is common in Barcelona. I thought I would venture up to the roof top to check out the pool and it was a tad scary walking around a narrow path leading to the pool which looked clean but the water was freezing. Sadly I found the hotel was in an average location and the next day when I was checking out, I spent time sitting and watching and listening to the female receptionists who were very *icy* to the tourists coming and going. I would not stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not more than OK”
Reviews.Author: CROCRO1
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the hotel with 2 more family members during August. Reception didnt seem to know English very well. The rooms are very basic. The couch in the room was filthy. Bedsheets were fairly clean but the matresses seemed old. The third bed in the room was very uncomfortable and narrow (as if it was for kids). The rooms are not quiet. Everytime someone opened or shut a door , the room shook. You could hear people talking in the next room and you can hear their TV as well. Breakfast was ok, not very diverse. The only good thing I can say about the hotel is it's excellant location. It is literally 1 minute from a Metro station and about 10 minutes from a very nice mall near the Aqbar tower. It is also about a 20 min walk from Sagrada Familia. If you don't mind a low standard hotel this is a good place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Not 4 star”
Reviews.Author: kicking_asphalt
Reviews.Content: I had booked this room at Catelonia Atenas because it was cheap for a 4 star...was 4 star for 2 star price. But it was indeed a 2 star. Our room was small, about 1/2 foot from end of bed to table, but was not a problem. However room tends to get/feel very dusty all the time, in spite of daily housekeeping. It was not exactly close to Sagrada Familia as advertised, you would see the distance when at the rooftop pool, but it is just in front of Clot station, which then makes it easy to get around. This was my 2nd choice as the hotels at La Ramblas was fully booked and having little homework of the place, did not settle for any of the surrounding areas (Barri Gothic and Passeig de Gracia - which would be just adjacent to La Rambla - maps make them look far, or Colon Square is fine too). My take is, if you can't get La Rambla, take the other 2, the location saves you time and money commuting on the very efficient metro (credit given), which could go to the round the clock shopping.

Reviews.Title: “We Felt Invisible”
Reviews.Author: paulihatethathotel
Reviews.Content: A warning to people from Ireland & U.K., if you like drinking tea don't stay at this hotel. This might seem trivial to a lot of people, but these simple services build the foundation of every great hotels success and this hotel lacked a hell of a lot of the basics, making our stay very uncomfortable and we will think again about hotels in general in Barcelona. Apart from the aforementioned tea debacle, the room service was a joke, 2 tea pots in the whole hotel (lets see, thats 9 floors with about 25 rooms a floor, do the math, thats a lot of people with hot water, let alone tea!) The reception ignored you unless you were part of a coach party, which they seem to have a lot of. P.S. The "Swimming Pool"....I think I could build a bigger one out my back garden and it was freezing cold, whats that about?

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, rooms quite noisey though”
Reviews.Author: seansheep
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel, made a very good first impression. Very keen, and friendly talkative staff (although talking the receptionist talking to the people behind us in the queue in preference to answering out questions was a bit too much). The room was quite small but very well appointed with a generous bathroom w/ hairdryer etc. Swimming pool is tiny, but the view from the top is great, plus plenty of seating if you wanted to relax in the sun... would be a nice place to go at night, but unfortunately closed at 2130 when we were there. I'm normally a heavy sleeper but the doors must have been very thin since I was frequently woken by people walking along the corridor or the room cleaners. Didn't appreciate being woken by the cleaning lady at 9 am on Sunday morning dispite displaying the "Do Not Disturb Sign". Top tip: the baguetteria next door is very good, and a lot cheaper than the hotel breakfast (didn't try the breakfast so can't comment on comparative quality). If it wasn't for the noise and being woken on Sunday morning (we were there 4 nights, I don't know why Sunday was any different) then this would have been excellent value for money. Unfortunately sleep is the main reason you need a hotel, and so comes out rather average because of that.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Sparky38
Reviews.Content: Hotel in ideal location, just round the corner from the Metro station (Clot). Staff really friendly and very helpful. Breakfast was excellent with a wide choice. Hotel was very clean and there was a treat on the roof with a lovely sun deck and swimming pool. The pool is small but much needed after touring the City on a hot day. Would definitely go back - absolutely fantastic!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Avoid This Hotel By All Means”
Reviews.Author: Terence1975
Reviews.Content: This is NOT a 4 star hotel at all. I had a terrible experience there: 1/ the room are very unequal - some of them were refurbished in 2004 and certainly don't match the 4 star standards, but most of them are really old and suffer from all sort of problems: -bathroom badly isolated, could feel the fresh air from outside which was very unpleasant in the early morning) -windows are single layered on the back side of the hotel, meaning you can enjoy the nightlife of Barcelona even when you are in your bed. I was there during Mobile World Congress, hence the hotel was fully booked and I could not get any better room. 2/ during my stay, there was some problem with dirty water from the distribution network and the staff had to let all the water taps open for 10 min in all rooms during the day. Unfortunately, the taps were left open for the whole day in the room straight up mine, leading to a massive water leakage which totally destroyed the ceiling of my room. You can see the pictures. My clothes were totally under water as well as my cell phone which I had unintentionally left in my room during that day. No need to say the cell phone was dead ! And some of my clothes did not like the water either. No problem, they said, the insurance will cover that. I took that for granted, but I was wrong (read further). The only positive consequence of this incident was that I got another room that night, but unfortunately the hotel management made absolutely no gesture at all to compensate the inconveniences caused by this leakage. They did not even apologize for that. I said fine, as long as the insurance repairs for the damaged items. The hotel manager signed a list of these items and said it would be fine. 3/ I have sent an email to the hotel this week to inquire about the status of the insurance case. To my big surprise, this is the email I got back: "Dear Sir, Our Insurance Company needs to check the damaged objects in place, and actually in this case no reimbursement will be done for these reasons. Our Hotel in your next visit will have a special attention with you and we hope we can offer a solution even if, as our insurance company inform, They doesn’t accept to process any compensation, we will do our best to give you another alternatives." So they basically lied to me when they said that all damages would be covered. No need to say that I will never go back to this hotel so I won't accept any other type of compensation such as a free night there... With a recent 6000 series Nokia cell phone dead, damages caused to expensive clothes, poor room experience, and such a un-pleasant relationship with the hotel management, I have nothing else to say that what is written in my title: AVOID CATALONIA ATENAS HOTEL BY ALL MEANS. Terence Blaise, Belgium

Reviews.Title: “Would not return to this hotel”
Reviews.Author: PhilipNL
Reviews.Content: I booked a room for 8 nights on recommendation of an event organiser for a forum I was attending in Barcelona. The first room I had was a cubicle and that was quickly changed to a decent sized double-room when I remonstrated. It is close to Clot metro and that makes it easy to get around town, it has a room-top view on the 11th floor with a swimming pool, though it was too cold to use. The housekeeping was bad, at one time the housekeeper literally went in from of me at 19:30 to clean a room I had vacated since 7:30 in the morning. The Do Not Disturb sign seem to mean nothing to the staff, twice my room was walked into and twice also, someone had remove the signs from all our doors on a Sunday morning. If you are not in a group, think of using restaurants in town rather than the hotel. As business traveller, this hotel is more 2* than 4*. I would definitely not return to this hotel or any in the hotel group - it was definitely not home away from home.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended - good out of city centre location”
Reviews.Author: annettejean57
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 4 days over Easter 2007 (myself, husband & 12 year old son). Rooms functional rather than overly comfortable, but staff friendly & helpful, breakfast plentiful and great location for exploring. Opposite metro station (Clot) and couple of minutes walk to mainline station (El Clot Arago) - we took the train back to the airport which was much more fun (and loads cheaper) than a taxi! Once we had purchased a metro "travelcard" there was no stopping us, and it was quite good to get away from the centre after a busy day/evening out. Also walkable to Sagrada Familia and we walked back from Arc de Triomf once. Hotel was busy because of Easter (bit chaotic couple of mornings at breakfast) but relatively quiet the rest of the time. Only problem was the weather which was appalling! Suggest you take jeans and jumpers even in April! Would definitely recommend if you want to save some money on city centre hotels, and yes would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “my review”
Reviews.Author: jmWales
Reviews.Content: me and my boyfriend stayed here in march 2007, it was ok but wouldnt stay again,full of noisy students,our room was tiny although we were moved to another room the next day after complaining,staff were very nice, but this is definetely not a 4 star hotel, breakfast was good, dinner was not, i wouldnt recomend this, definetely not.

Reviews.Title: “Recommended :-)”
Reviews.Author: SANDYSCOT
Reviews.Content: Couldn't fault this hotel or staff. Thoroughly enjoyed my stay and the location. Walking distance to Sangrata Familia (?) and right beside metro station. Metro so easy to use and only 5 stops into the centre. There are also shops around the hotel and a good shopping centre about 10 minutes walk away. Breakfast in the hotel was super with lots of choice. Ate in the hotel one night which was lovely. Quiet and lovely staff. Found every member of staff mannerly and helpful - so much so that I wrote to head office and the hotel manager complimenting them. Would definitely go back again.

Reviews.Title: “Fab family friendly”
Reviews.Author: danruane
Reviews.Content: Stayed with my wife and two year od daughter. Hotel is very clean and staff very friendly. We had not ordered a cot but on checking in the staff were very helpful and within ten minutes a maid came to the room and set up the cot. Room was of a very good standard and was very impressed by the large size, with enough free space for another double bed. The only down side was the single glazing which did let in some of the noise from the street, but it was not that bad. Buffet breakfast was excellent and staff very attentive. The location is ideal for access to the city centre with a metro station accross the road. All in all a very enjoyable stay, would reccomend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed the Atenas”
Reviews.Author: Tommy2925
Reviews.Content: We went to Barcelona as part of a group of 8 and, having read some of the previous reports, I was more than a little concerned about our projected stay. It would appear that the Hotel has made huge improvements since some of those reports were submitted. We found all the staff to be extremely helpful, The check in staff / receptionists all speak excellent English and were very approachable. The bar is small but well stocked and very friendly bar staff help improve the ambience. Our room was excellent, immaculately clean and well stocked. The breakfast costs 10 Euros extra but comes in the shape of a very well stocked hot and cold buffet. The food was excellent. We stayed for 3 nights ( Fri, Sat & Sun) and enjoyed it. They have clearly worked hard to improve from the bad reports they have received in the past. We found the hotel ideaaly placed to explore the entire city and we intend to return to visit. We would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable and Friendly Stay”
Reviews.Author: 3elles
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Hotel for 7 nights with my 15 year old daughter, we both thought it was really lovely. Room and bathroom were spacious and very clean. All staff very friendly and helpful. The buffet breakfast was excellant lots of different and tasty things to choose from. We had a great time and would definately go back to this hotel. Would recommend it to family and friends. L & L Edinburgh Scotland.

Reviews.Title: “No sleep, no air, no security!!!”
Reviews.Author: dengelbery
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for Valentine's week and it was NOT the greatest place to stay but since the company was paying for it, I had to grit my teeth and bear it. The weather was nice (sweatshirt during the day and a coat at night). This was my first trip to Spain so I don't know how A/C is suppose to function. What I call A/C in the USA is not what I call A/C in Spain. I think it's called a "machine-that-made-noise-and-call-it-an-air-conditioning unit". Every night I couldn't sleep because it was so hot and humid inside the room. I had to resort to opening the windows, but I got all the noise from the streets so I couldn't sleep either way. The bed was a "king" but they were actually two "larger than twin, but not yet a full size" put together. My bf and I couldn't snuggle together unless we were in the same small bed which we couldn't move around in much. Our room was on the 6th floor facing the elevator so we heard every single loud [--] drunk who came home from the bars (lol). There is no room service and no ice machine. We bought some champagne to celebrate Valentine's but in order to chill it, we had to go to the bar and ask the bartender for ice. They gave it to me in a plastic bag (lol) and we had to use the small wastebasket that was lined with a plastic bag as a Champagne chiller. Sad. I would not recommend staying here period. The safe that was provided in the room did not even have a LOCK so you must bring all your valuables wherever you go!!! I winded up losing my flight and had to stay in Barcelona again and stayed at the Aparthotel Silver [--]. It was around $61/night and it was 100% BETTER with better amenities and a better night's sleep! Aparthotel Silver also had a small kitchen so you could cook.

Reviews.Title: “Totally disagree with bad reviews”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I booked a staff trip for 10 to Catalonia Atenis for a holiday weekend. I didn't read the reviews until after the booking so was dreading it not being up to standard. However we were pleasantly surprised. My room was very clean, no smells and some of the rooms were very spacious. I couldn't believe it when I saw the green light on the smoke alarm that someone in a previous review said kept them awake all night. It is a tiny sensor light (grain of rice) and if flashes approximately every 20 seconds, if you blink you would miss it. In fact I would never have noticed it if I hadn't deliberately looked for it. The breakfast was excellent. In fact I have stayed in many hotels and have not had such a selection to choose from. Something for everyone. The only disappointment was the pool was shut . Would definitely use this hotel again as very handy for the metro also.

HotelInfo.Name: Catalonia Atenas Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: Avda Meridiana 151, 08026 Barcelona, Spain
